main event: On 7 September 1951, in Claremont, California, a civilian reported observing six bright orange lights in the sky for approximately 3 to 4 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were observed moving in irregular circles with the last two well in toward the center of the formation,One additional sighting of a lone bright orange light followed the first,All objects faded into the coastal fog,The altitude of the objects was estimated to be around 10-12,000 feet,Two airmen confirmed the sightings but there was no investigation into the incident.
sighted object: six bright orange lights and one lone bright orange light
